item.title: Lightning-keymap-mode for Emacs
item.description: Reinventing navigation in Emacs by providing a layered minor mode keymap.

item.title: Music
item.description: In this blog I will document my journey to find the perfect sound. I will cover Linux audio software, best practice in recording, mixing, and mastering, as well as some useful tools and hacks from the field of digital signal processing.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD student in physics, a passionated programmer, a vehement open-source user, a picky musician, and an aspiring artist. In this blog I want to share my experiences, present the solutions I found to encountered problems and maybe help some other people out there facing similar challenges.

item.title: Coding
item.description: A bunch of tutorials, projects, and hacks in various computer languages and topics. Some reoccurring themes are the statistical programming language R, Emacs, and the handling of data in general.

item.title: Digital art
item.description: My humble attempt to produce some digital art (excluding music).

item.title: Climex R package + shiny app
item.description: A R package to perform a more robust extreme value analysis (EVA) on climatic time series. It also features a shiny web application to provide a convenient interface for people not familiar with either R or EVA.

item.title: Mensacard hack
item.description: In this little project, I dived into the NFC technology in order to access the information of a local cafeteria card using both an Android phone and an Arduino.

item.title: Which part of town does fit me most?
item.description: The award-winning web app written by Stephan, Justus, and me at a Hackathon in 2016 for the city of Dresden.

item.title: wxArt - neural style transfer in Python
item.description: A Python interface to perform a style transfer between images using artificial intelligence and deep neuronal networks.
